datafield.subfield: Herbert L. Kirk (1926-1994) was a writer, editor, and publishing consultant. The collection chiefly consists of material relating to his book, Pablo Casals, a Biography (Holt, Rinehart and Winston, 1974). It includes his extensive research material on Casals, his research notes and business papers, correspondence, photographs, programs, drafts and proofs of the book, clippings, articles, posters, and a scrapbook.

titlestmt.author: Processed by the Music Division of the Library of Congress

seriesstmt.titleproper: Guides to Special Collections in the Music Division of the Library of Congress

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Music Division, 2012

did.head: Collection Summary
did.langmaterial: Collection material in English, Spanish and French
did.abstract: Herbert L. Kirk (1926-1994) was a writer, editor, and publishing consultant. The collection chiefly consists of material relating to his book, Pablo Casals, a Biography (Holt, Rinehart and Winston, 1974). It includes his extensive research material on Casals, his research notes and business papers, correspondence, photographs, programs, drafts and proofs of the book, clippings, articles, posters, and a scrapbook.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Herbert L. Kirk Collection was processed by Stefan Patejak in 1999. Nancy Seeger revised the finding aid and coded it for EAD format in 2012.

separatedmaterial.head: Transfers
separatedmaterial.p: One hundred audiotapes and a videotape containing concerts, documentaries, and interviews that Kirk made in the course of his research have been transferred to the Library of Congress Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division. Some of the audiotapes have been individually cataloged and are identified as part of the "H. L. Kirk Collection (Library of Congress)."

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Materials from the Herbert L. Kirk Collection are governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.) and other applicable international copyright laws.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Herbert L. Kirk Collection is open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Music Division prior to visiting in order to determine whether the desired materials will be available at that time.
Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [item, date, container number], Herbert L. Kirk Collection, Music Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Herbert L. Kirk was a writer, editor and publishing consultant when he first met Pablo Casals in 1960. In his own words, "my first reaction was veneration." They became close friends and in 1966 Casals invited Kirk to write his authorized biography. Kirk was given extensive access to Casals and his records. The book was finished in 1973 within hours of Casals' death. In his will, Kirk left his research material and other related items to the Library of Congress.

Herbert L. Kirk was born in Orlando, Florida, on July 26, 1926. He earned an A.B. degree from Wake Forest College, and attended graduate school at Columbia University and New York University. After serving in the U.S. Army, he made New York City his home and began pursuing a career in book publishing. He held various editorial and executive positions at Prentice-Hall, Ronald Press, Appleton-Century-Crofts, Macmillan, and Hill & Wang. He headed H. L. Kirk Associates, a small editorial consulting firm, and served as an advisory editor for McGraw-Hill.

Although Mr. Kirk never studied the cello, he was an accomplished amateur pianist and very knowledgeable about classical music. He came to know Casals well during the time that the cellist was associated with the Marlboro Festival in Vermont, where Kirk and his wife had a summer house in nearby Jacksonville. Kirk's biography of Casals, Pablo Casals, a Biography, was his only notable published work.
Kirk died in New York City, on October 31, 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Herbert L. Kirk is best known in the field of musicology as the author of Pablo Casals, a Biography (Holt, Rinehart and Winston, 1974), the authorized biography of Pablo Casals. The bulk of the material in the Kirk collection is related to this book and includes various drafts of the work and material gathered in researching the subject.

The Correspondence series includes correspondence between Kirk and Casals, letters to and from Pablo and Marta Casals, business correspondence to and from Kirk regarding his research for the book and other projects, and a selection of acknowledgments from persons who received presentation copies of the book. It also contains photocopies of letters from Casals to Sir Donald Tovey.

The Photographs series contains pictures, both candid and posed, of Pablo Casals that Kirk gathered in researching his book. It also inlcudes photographs of Casals' wife Marta, relatives, associates, houses, and awards. There are also pictures of Kirk and his family, some with Casals. Many photographs show Casals in performance, and with notable individuals. In addition, there is a complete set of illustrations that was used in the book. The Programs series contains an extensive set of programs documenting Casals' performances.

The Pablo Casals Papers series contains materials directly related to Pablo Casals, including legal and business papers, transcripts of interviews that Kirk had with Casals, Casals' music lessons, chronologies of Casals' career, photocopies of some of his musical compositions, and scripts. The collection includes numerous drafts and proofs of Kirk's book--both of the main text and of the front and back matter--which can be found in the Pablo Casals Book Material series. Many of the versions contain corrections and annotations. The Research Material and Research Notes series contain respectively the files of research material that Kirk amassed and notes made in the course of researching and writing his book. These files were kept intact upon receipt and Kirk's original order of these materials has been retained. Additional research materials include newspaper and magazine clippings, whole magazines, and books about Casals and related subjects.

The Realia series contains souvenir medals from Casals festivals and a pipe that Casals gave to Kirk. The Scrapbook contains clippings related to Kirk's book on Casals, and the Posters series contains two posters.
The Kirk Business Papers series contains materials, including permissions, receipts, and promotional items, relating to Kirk's book and other activities.

arrangement.head: Organization of the Herbert L. Kirk Collection
arrangement.p: The Herbert L. Kirk Collection is organized in fifteen series:

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between Kirk and Casals, letters to and from Pablo and Marta Casals, correspondence to and from Kirk regarding his research for the book and other projects, and a selection of acknowledgments from persons who received presentation copies of the book.

did.unittitle: Correspondence between Herbert L. Kirk and Pablo and Marta Casals, 1961-1969
Correspondence between Herbert L. Kirk and Pablo and Marta Casals, 1970-1973
Correspondence from Pablo Casals to Donald Tovey, 1912-1938

note.p: Includes copies of letters about Tovey and Casals, and one 1973 letter from an Edinburgh librarian concerning the Casals letters.
Producer-director of Pablo Casals. Includes additional materials.

did.unittitle: Society of Friends of Puerto Rico, 1970
Acknowledgements to Kirk regarding Casals book, 1974

scopecontent.p: Photographs of various sizes, in black and white, and color, including posed and candid shots, snapshots, and items from printed sources. Subjects include Casals, his wife and family, friends, and notable individuals. Includes slides and contact sheets.

did.unittitle: Casals family members (with and without Pablo Casals), circa 1870, 1933, 1953
Pablo Casals with cello, with Marta, circa 1970
Pablo Casals with cello, with others, 1929-1970
Photographs and illustrations for Kirk's book on Casals
Materials relating to photographs and illustrations appearing in Kirk's book on Casals

note.p: Includes permissions, editorial materials, and photographer credits.

did.unittitle: Negatives of various sizes (DO NOT SERVE)

scopecontent.p: Covers a selection of performances by Casals, includes photocopies and a few originals.

Miscellaneous materials related to Pablo Casals, including legal and business papers, transcripts of interviews that Kirk had with Casals, Casals' music lessons, chronologies of Casals' career, photocopies of some of his musical compositions, and scripts.

did.unittitle: Transcripts of five Pablo Casals lessons, 1954

note.p: Lessons made available to Kirk by Virgil Thomson.

did.unittitle: Scripts for various projects about Casals, 1964-1976, undated

scopecontent.p: Typewritten manuscripts and photocopies of drafts and galley proofs for Kirk's book, Pablo Casals, a Biography. Some versions contain annotations and corrections. Includes material relating to the front matter, back matter, and the dust jacket, as well as handwritten pages and fragments.

did.unittitle: Drafts of Kirk's book Pablo Casals, 1971-1972

note.p: Includes some typed fragments and handwritten pages.

did.unittitle: Photocopied fragments and miscellaneous photocopied pages
Annotated, typed drafts of acknowledgements; appendix 1, discography; appendix 2, honors and awards; bibliography; captions; and corrections
Annotated, typed drafts of footnotes, index, jacket, outline, preface, and table of contents

scopecontent.p: Research material Kirk gathered in researching the Casals book.

arrangement.p: Alphabetically arranged by name of person or subject.

did.unittitle: Clippings, correspondence, notes, maps, brochures, booklets, programs and other materials
Handwritten and typed notes that Kirk made in researching the Casals book; includes index cards
Newspaper and magazine clippings that Kirk gathered on Casals and related subjects (originals and photocopies), 1890-1976, undated
Magazines and articles that Kirk gathered in the course of researching his book on Casals
Two souvenir medals from Casals Festivals and a pipe that Casals gave to Kirk
Scrapbook with reviews and clippings about Kirk's book on Casals

scopecontent.p: Books about Pablo Casals that Kirk collected in the course of researching his book. Five of the books listed here were presented to Kirk and inscribed by their authors. These have been retained, along with Kirk’s annotated working copy of his own book, and are shelved with the collection. The remaining volumes have been placed in the general collections or, in the case of duplicates, disposed of. A complete list of these volumes is available in the Library of Congress Music Division collection file.
